title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is <.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. $$y<\frac{-1}{2} x+2$$ $$0<0\frac{-1}{2}+2$$ $$0<2$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y<\frac{-1}{2} x+2$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, we shade the left side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is <.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. $$y<x-2$$ $$0<0-2$$ $$0<-2$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is not a solution to $$y<x-2$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, so we shade in the right side of the line $$y=x-2$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
